title: Arsenal vs Aston Villa confirmed line-ups: Team news and more ahead of Premier League clash
text:
Arsenal welcome Aston Villa to the Emirates Stadium for a Sunday afternoon Premier League clash.

Both sides drew their last Premier League game, with Arsenal fortunate to escape with a point from Vicarage Road and Aston Villa held at home to West Ham.

Unai Emery’s side enjoyed a confidence boosting Europa League win in midweek, but remains without Alexandre Lacazette, with the striker out until next month at the earliest.

We’ll tell you what’s true. You can form your own view. From 15p €0.18 $0.18 USD 0.27 a day, more exclusives, analysis and extras.

Matt Targett is fit and could make his Aston Villa debut after joining the club in the summer.

Here is all the information ahead of the game at the Emirates.

Team News

Unai Emery will still be without Alex Lacazette, Hector Bellerin and Kieran Tierney. He rotated heavily in midweek, with the likes of Sokratis, Mesut Ozil and Nicholas Pepe all set to come back into the side.

Villa have been boosted by the return of Matt Targett, who has not featured since his move from Southampton in the summer.

Dean Smith also has Trezeguet available, after he missed the West Ham game through suspension.

Confirmed Line-ups

Arsenal: Leno, Maitland-Niles, Papastathopoulos, Luiz, Kolasinac, Guendouzi, Xhaka, Pepe, Ceballos, Saka, Aubameyang.

Aston Villa: Heaton, Guilbert, Engels, Mings, Taylor, McGinn, Nakamba, Grealish, Trezeguet, Wesley, El Ghazi.

When is it?

Kick off between Arsenal and Villa is 4.30pm on Sunday September 22.

How can I watch it?

Due to the Chelsea vs Liverpool match kicking off at the same time, no UK channel will be broadcasting the game live.

Highlights will be available to watch on Match of the Day 2 on Sunday night at 10.35pm on BBC One.

Odds

Arsenal 2/5

Draw 4/1

Villa 7/1

Our Prediction

Arsenal and Villa both tend to play expansively, so we can expect this game to be open with chances for both sides.

Bjorn Engels and Tyrone Mings have impressed for Villa at the back, but will face their toughest test yet in Aubameyang and Pepe, with the latter keen to get his first goal for the club.

Wesley has come under some criticism since his move from Club Brugge, but faces an Arsenal defence that have looked shaky in every match and may be able to profit.

Arsenal 3-1 Villa

10 mins to kick off. Can Arsenal move back into the top four with a win? Arsenal will need to improve on their last league game, a 2-2 draw at Watford where defeat looked likely despite having been two goals up. Aubameyang is chasing the golden boot once again this season. A hat trick today would take him level with Aguero on eight. Aston Villa will be looking to move out of the relegation zone. Their only league win came against Everton just under a month ago. Advertisement Lacazette injured, but Aubameyang and 18 year old Saka produced the goods in Germany on Thursday. The latter an exciting prospect. Another big day for him against Villa. Aston Villa: Heaton Guilbert Engels Mings Taylor Nakamba McGinn Grealish El Ghazi Trezeguet Wesley Arsenal: Leno Maitland-Niles David Luiz Sokratis Kolasinac Xhaka Guendouzi Ceballos Pepe Aubameyang Saka Just under an hour before Arsenal take on Aston Villa... Here's our preview. Advertisement Welcome to The Independent's live coverage of Arsenal vs Aston Villa. Unai Emery will hope Arsenal can reaffirm their top four credentials at home to Aston Villa. The Gunners were undone by Watford last weekend but bounced back in the Europa League midweek to breeze past Frankfurt.
